1: This app fig-ures out whether your photo is a fig or not.

2: Figs cannot speak English, but they would probably just say obcenities if they could.

3: New Jersey made figs their national fruit in 1965. Fitting.

4: Contrary to popular belief, figs are actually vegetables.

5: Figs were harmed in the making of this app.

6: According to the Bible, Jesus once cursed a fig tree because it bore no fruit.

7: Fig tree flowers are actually hidden inside the fruit, which led many early cultures to believe the plants to be flowerless.

8: California grows many varieties of figs, but the two most common are the amber-colored, slightly nutty-flavored Golden and the dark purple, sweet Mission.

9: Many believe it was figs that were actually the fruit in the Garden of Eden with Adam and Eve, not apples.

10: All figs possess the same amount of internal seeds. No one has bothered to count them though.

11: Romania banned the importation of figs into the country from 1993-1998 due to a suspected illness associated with their consumption.

12: According to a 2013 survey held by students of Charles University of Prague, 34% of Czechs present a strong distaste for figs.

13: A study held in 1971 found that eating too many figs can increase your chances of developing arthritis by the age of 60 by 43%.

14: Morocco has the highest consumption per capita of figs in the world. Coincidentally, some consider the country among the worst in the world.

15: The ingestion of figs on airplanes has been known to increase motion sickness and worsen the effects of jet lag.

16: In 2019, there were 28 recorded fig related deaths (9 in Egypt alone).

17: Fig species include trees, vines, shrubs, and even epiphytes.

18: Figs are known as an omen of disease, decay and destruction in many Polynesian cultures.

19: The Convolutional Neural Network is the best and most efficient method of fig detection.

20: Figs are considered the first cultivated fruit, with fossil records dating back to at least 9200 B.C.

21: The Roman statesman Cato the Elder once persuaded Rome to go on the Third Punic War against Carthage (146 B.C.) over a fig.

22: Fig Fossils dating back to 16 Million B.C.E. have recently been discovered by archaelogists in New Mexico.

24: Figs are objectively the worst fruit. All those who disagree are wrong.

25: Chrysippus of Soli, an Ancient Greek Stoic philosopher, allegedly died of laughter after witnessing a donkey eating figs.

26: California produces 100% of the country's dried figs and 98% of its fresh figs.
